intro: Centrostachys carsonii, commonly known as Carson's centrosema, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a shallow root system and is often found in open grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
